current_fact.fact_text: In 1990, Washington, D.C. mayor Marion Barry was arrested in an FBI sting operation for drug possession, a dramatic fall captured on hidden cameras. episode.title: Morning Drops #27 - Nomophobia
episode.description: Yasmin reflects on what happened when she recently lost her phone and why it felt freeing. A dive into the psychology of our relationship with smartphones: from nomophobia (the fear of being without a phone), to digital burnout and cognitive overload, to the surprising benefits of boredom and the brain's default mode network. An invitation to rethink how we connect and disconnect.

published.fact_text: In 1977, scientists at the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention finally pinned down the mysterious cause of Legionnaires’ disease: a previously unknown bacterium later named Legionella pneumophila. The breakthrough came after a baffling outbreak at an American Legion convention and marked a milestone in epidemiology and environmental health.

episode.title: Morning Drops #42 - The Joy Of Learning
episode.description:
Hosted by Yasmin, this Morning Drop explores learning as a lifelong process, focusing on persistence, repetition, and the emotional landscape that comes with challenging oneself over time.

Through personal stories and scientific insights, the episode looks at how learning reshapes the brain, generates joy through effort, and why progress often arrives after confusion and frustration. It reflects on the so-called delayed pleasure effect, the role of dopamine in motivation, and how curiosity and learning support long-term wellbeing.

The episode also questions our cultural relationship with failure and invites a softer, more realistic approach to learning, one that accepts mistakes as part of growth and sees persistence as a quiet form of strength.

Mood: reflective, grounded, quietly hopeful
Music genre: alternative rock, hip hop, electronic, neo-soul, drill

A space to listen slowly and stay with the process.

published.match_reason: A story about solving a scientific mystery fits an episode centered on learning, persistence, and the slow joy of finally understanding something difficult.

episode.title: Morning Drops #43 - Looking Back
episode.description:
In this first Morning Drop of 2026, Yasmin opens a space for quiet reflection on the nature of transitions. The episode traces a personal journey that began three years ago, when a sudden injury on New Year’s Day turned a desire for movement into a mandatory season of stillness.

Through the story of a broken knee and the slow process of relearning to walk, the narrative explores the difference between being strong and being aware. It touches on the vulnerability of the body, the unexpected joy found in daily progress, and the warmth that comes from finally allowing oneself to accept help. The musical selection mirrors this path of recovery, moving from the uncertainty of change to the steady rhythm of healing.

Music genre: Indie Pop, Cinematic, World, Soul

We invite you to listen deeply and find comfort in your own pace.
